results.title: F-111 the first flight
results.creator_credit: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Trainee pilots and navigators undergo an intensive training course before they are allowed to operate the supersonic F-111 strike aircraft for the first time. Shows some of the students on their first flight in an F-111. Credits include: photography by Mal Lancaster; edited by Vincent Donovan; sound by Ron Townsend; commentated by Peter Gwynne and scripted by Greg Parry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: The Double-spandrel bridge
results.brief_description: China has a long history in bridge building, but the cross curved arch bridge or the “double spandrel bridge” is a new breakthrough in the history of China’s bridge construction. Easy, quick and inexpensive to build, and full of national characteristics, it economises on materials and facilitates transport and communications. Shows the development and construction of some of China’s 1,200 double spandrel bridges. In English with Chinese and English subtitles.

results.title: Man hunt
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Reed Executive Selection and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Outlines how to conduct effective staff selection interviews. John Cleese portrays the managers, Ethel the Unready, Ivan the Terrible and William the Silent who show the common mistakes of lack of preparation, failure to encourage the candidate to talk openly and relevantly and failing to introduce direct and probing questions. Norman Bowler demonstrates the correct interview techniques.

results.title: The Amish: a people of preservation
results.brief_description: Discusses various aspects of the Amish community, including history, their world view, and the simplicity of their lifestyle. Shows various family activities. A shorter 26 minute version of this program is available on video and film.

results.title: About a dollar's worth
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Department of Defence, Defence Public Relations
results.brief_description: Employs constructive montage and synthetic music to illustrate the benefits of the Royal Australian Air Force to Australians. Looks at training of personnel, rescue work, training of overseas personnel, and social activities.

results.title: Zinc
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Principles of Chemical Processes”.
Electrochemistry, thermodynamics and chemical kinetics are used to provide the basis for explaining the industrial extraction of zinc from its ores.

results.title: Zebras
results.creator_credit: Choice Films and GK Film, Stockholm
results.brief_description: An animated film of uncommon warmth and humor by the Swedish artist Johan Hagelback. Two zebras happily discover each other, and then, unhappily, lose one of their stripes. They investigate every visible form and shape until they recover the vital black stripe of their own.

results.title: Yuzen kimono
results.brief_description: Shows how the Yuzen-Kimono is made in Kyoto. We follow the process from the designing and making of the wide variety of beautiful hand painted materials, the hand sewing of the traditional kimonos and finally the wearing of them by children and women of all ages on special occasions in the ancient city of Kyoto. Without commentary - music only with English intertitles.

results.title: Youth, maturity, old age and death
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
In four minutes, and not moving from one spot, Marceau expresses the seven-ages-of-humankind, beginning with life emerging from a mother’s womb, through the cycle of life, to the grave. Marceau believes “this pantomime reveals, maybe the best of what mime can do in condensing time.”
